Question: To broaden his coalition to include War Democrats as well as Republicans, this person ran under the label of the new Union Party.
Hints: Despite the bitterness of the defeat for this person, his articulation of the issues gave him a national political reputation.
This person's death was the first assassination of a U.S.
This person received 1,866,452 votes, Douglas 1,376,957 votes, Breckinridge 849,781 votes, and Bell 588,789 votes.
